quest.name: Old Sharlayan, New to You
journal: Krile sweeps the Scions with a speculative look.
objectives: Speak with Krile while accompanied by G'raha Tia.
Head to the Last Stand while accompanied by G'raha Tia and Krile, and speak with Krile at the designated location.
Head to the aetheryte plaza while accompanied by G'raha Tia and Krile, and speak with Krile at the designated location.
Head to the Agora while accompanied by G'raha Tia and Krile, and speak with Krile at the designated location.
Head to the Rostra while accompanied by G'raha Tia and Krile, and speak with Krile at the designated location.
Head to Journey's End while accompanied by G'raha Tia and Krile, and speak with Krile at the designated location.
Head to the Baldesion Annex while accompanied by G'raha Tia and Krile, and speak with Krile at the designated location.
Speak with Krile in the main hall.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I'm fine. Honestly. Better to be waved through with a stern warning than be denied entry, after all.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: That was about as awkward as expected. Still, we're here now, and that's all that matters!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Even allowing that the years I spent in the First passed here in the blink of an eye, the city feels untouched by time...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Allow me to extend unto thee my warmest welcome, Forename. May the wisdom of my homeland aid us in our endeavors.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: You are doubtless eager to take in the sights. Not to worry, Forename─the city is not like to vanish before we finish our discussion.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Here we are at last─the great city of Sharlayan! You may have noticed some similarities with the Crystarium, yes? In fact, I─

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: ...Oh, but we really should let Krile have her say first. We can continue this conversation at another time.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I am...unaccustomed to fabricating lies on demand. Why should it matter how I earn my living?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I had thought to launch directly into an explanation of what I've learned and how we might proceed...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: But this is Forename and Estinien's first time in Sharlayan─and for the rest of you, a homecoming that was long overdue.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: You must have places you wish to visit, and people you're dying to see! Therefore I propose we postpone our agenda so that you all may have sufficient time to recover from your journey and get your bearings in the city.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Once you've settled in, we can reconvene at the Baldesion Annex. How does that sound?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: 'Tis a fine suggestion. We may not be welcome at the Leveilleur estate as such, but I should like to nose around the neighborhood all the same.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I am equally untethered, as it were. There is no particular place that my kin call “home”...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Still, I would not pass up the opportunity to reacquaint myself with the city.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Likewise. A quick tour of our old haunts might even yield some useful gossip.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The annex was west of the aetheryte plaza, wasn't it? I shall join you there anon.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Yes, we'll see you there!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I, too, have places I would be remiss in not visiting forthwith. By thy leave...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: What of you, Estinien? My services as a guide are yours for the asking.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: That won't be necessary. Until we reconvene, I prefer to wander as the wind takes me.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: B-But, I could─! Oh.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Well, Raha, would you like to join us, then? You've been gone for quite a while, and this would be the perfect way to refresh those dusty old memories of yours.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Oh! Of course─if you will have me!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Come, Forename! Sharlayan awaits!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Oh dear... His enthusiasm is infectious, isn't it?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: After you, my friend! I am more than content to follow your lead.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: G'raha Tia is now accompanying you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Keep him at your side in order to proceed with quest objectives.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In the event you use the Aethernet, G'raha Tia will catch up to you so long as you remain in the same area.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You can leave G'raha Tia behind, however, by entering a different area. You may also speak to him and select the option to part ways.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: If you wish to have G'raha Tia accompany you again, return and speak with him at the original location.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: While G'raha Tia is accompanying you, next try speaking with Krile.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Talk.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Part ways.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Do not forget Mistress Krile, our worthy guide!

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Are you sure you wish to part ways with your companions?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Private matters to attend to? Very well, we can regroup in Scholar's Harbor when you are ready to resume our tour.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! Shall we return to our exploration of Sharlayan?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Your companions have yet to arrive. Be sure they are at your side before attempting to continue.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Please, go ahead and invite Raha first. He's about to burst with excitement!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You must be accompanied by G'raha Tia and have him at your side in order to proceed with quest objectives.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: All set? Then let us be on our way!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Our first stop, amusingly enough, will be the Last Stand. It's a café on the west side of the harbor.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Krile is also now accompanying you. Lead your two companions to the Last Stand, and speak with Krile at the designated location.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: While you are accompanied, you may encounter “conversation points” along the way which offer additional topics of discussion.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Enter the glowing area and speak with your quest companions to initiate these bonus conversations. Enjoy exploring your surroundings together!

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Discuss the storage facility.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Discuss the giant statue in the harbor.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I'm grateful to have Krile's help in reacquainting myself with this place. It's almost as if I'm seeing it all with new eyes, as you are.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Ah, yes, the Last Stand. Now that is an inviting aroma!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Oh, we seem to have lost Mistress Krile. Perhaps we should head back to the harbor and look for her?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Come on, let's head to the café. It may not seem so at a glance, but the Last Stand is actually a very important part of the city.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Now where has Raha disappeared to? We should head back to the harbor and hope he looks for us there─he's liable to sulk if we carry on without him.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: With all the unusual wares coming and going at all hours, I expect the assistance of an intrepid adventurer would be highly appreciated.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I see no reason why you couldn't undertake any tasks which pique your interest─you have been cleared by the immigration officials, after all.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I look forward to the day your name is celebrated in Sharlayan the same way it is in Eorzea!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: This place is called “the peristyle,” and it is the first stop for cargo unloaded at the docks.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: You'll find the usual necessities for daily living and other imports vital to running an island nation, but also supplies that further Sharlayan's pursuit of knowledge─namely, large quantities of books, specimens, and samples. Sorting these stacks certainly seems to keep the attendants busy.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Now that is a sight one could hardly forget─the great statue of Thaliak.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: As a Student of Baldesion, I was usually quartered on the Isle of Val, but I would gaze upon the Scholar's wise features every time I returned by ship to the city.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: This path leading out towards the sea is known as “the Thaliak Stoa,” so named for the statue of the Scholar which stands at its end.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: As you know, the Sharlayan people prize the accumulation of wisdom above all else. Thus when Thaliak was chosen as our patron deity, it was more a matter of pragmatism than belief─an alignment of principles, as it were.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: We may have honored Him with a rather impressive sculpture, yes, but our faith is not so restrictive as that of, say, the Ishgardians. Individual Sharlayans can─and do!─worship the divinities of their choosing.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Of course, as you will. We can meet back at that spot in the harbor when you've time to continue the tour!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Yes, there are still places to go and things to show you. Come along!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Here we are at the Last Stand, but where is Raha...?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You must be accompanied by G'raha Tia and have him at your side in order to proceed with quest objectives.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: And here we are: the Last Stand.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I may have mentioned this before, but although our research into nutrition and food preparation is quite extensive, the average Sharlayan tends to regard seasoning and flavor with...a certain indifference.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: How can I put this? The food is, um... It's bland. As encapsulated by our infamous Archon loaf, the prevailing sentiment towards cuisine is dietary value first, and taste a distant second.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: There was one pupil at the Studium, however, who could stomach the school's insipid meals no longer. So he quit his lessons and poured all his savings into building a proper eatery.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: And so the Last Stand came to be. It is, as the name implies, the sole dedicated outpost of fine dining in Sharlayan. The one and only bastion of the culinary arts in an isle of otherwise mediocre fare.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I seem to recall their burger being hailed as one of the more impressive items on the menu. Not that I ever had the pleasure of eating one myself...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Because you were a typical Sharlayan when it came to “cheap and convenient,” Raha. But surely Tataru has since taught you how to appreciate a well-prepared dish! We should all stop in when time permits, and sample the café's delights!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Shall we press on? The stairs to the side of the café there will take us up to the aetheryte plaza.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: The Students of Baldesion would send us to investigate phenomena in locations across the world, so our funds were always stretched thin. And any spare coin I had went to books that caught my eye...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Food was the least of my concerns! Though now, having lived through some rather harrowing times, I've learned what a fortunate thing it is to be able to eat your fill.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Hm. The aetheryte looks different from how I remember it...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: On to the aetheryte plaza we go! We just need to head up the stairs next to the Last Stand.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: This is the aetheryte plaza...but where is Raha?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: An unusual shape, isn't it?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I assure you, however, that it's a perfectly functioning aetheryte. Remember to attune yourself before we move on!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Now, being the diligent tour guide that I am, I should make mention of the Confluence─a research facility located on this very plaza. Its much-vaunted discoveries are the reason Sharlayan stands at the forefront of teleportation technology.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: In deciphering the underlying principles of Allagan aetherytes, it allowed us to understand and reconstruct what was essentially a lost art.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: ...And off we go to our next destination! Our path leads northeast to the Agora, Sharlayan's largest marketplace.

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Discuss the Confluence.

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Discuss the book stalls.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Oh, the markets! I always did look forward to seeing what new wares they had on offer!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Anything worth cracking my coinpurse for today, I wonder...?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: You've attuned yourself to the aetheryte? Then let's continue on to the Agora.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Speaking of aetherytes, those teleportation fees do add up after a while...which is why I tended to rely on the far cheaper ferry services.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I was pleasantly surprised when Mistress Tataru informed me that the Scions are reimbursed for transportation costs as part of our duties, but I find old habits hard to break. That, and I'd rather not be bothered filling out the necessary paperwork.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: That's the entrance to the Confluence.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I have no doubt their expertise will prove useful at some point, so I suggest you remember the way here!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: ...Do you mind if I browse the shelves for a moment? There might be some hidden gems I've yet to read!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Only “a moment”? How optimistic. Feel free to browse all you like, but we won't wait around for you.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Ah. Perhaps I'll return here later, then...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: These little open-air book stalls are so uniquely Sharlayan. I'd always thought them a common sight until I visited other nations.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Well, here we are at the Agora, but we've lost Raha...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Welcome to the Agora, where you can find wares made in Sharlayan, as well as a wide selection of imported goods.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: They also used to sell questionable “prototypes” from the various research institutes, but I think that practice has thankfully died out. For the most part.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Otherwise, I can think of no better place to stock up for your next big adventure!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: ...Am I overselling it? Ahem. On a more serious note, the next stop on our tour is one which has particular relevance to our ultimate purpose here.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: We must head back to the aetheryte plaza, follow the path north, then climb the stairs up to that imposing building at the very top.

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: Discuss the water features.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: 'Tis a fascinating experience to walk around the city and contrast my image of the past with the reality of the present...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Ah, what an invigorating breeze. A touch biting, perhaps, but pleasant nonetheless.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: The building we're looking for sits at the top of the stairs, to the north of the aetheryte. Just keep walking up, and you'll reach it eventually.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: The district we're passing through is called Archons' Design─a name which honors the seven individuals whose contributions were instrumental in the founding of Sharlayan. It is the city's political and financial center, and it also hosts a collection of research institutions.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: These little decorative features are typical of Sharlayan architecture. Aside from the research wing, our headquarters on the Isle of Val were rather simple and rustic by comparison.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: This is the nymphaeum, an area dedicated to the blessings of water.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: For Sharlayans, water represents more than a life-sustaining liquid─it is a reminder of the great flood which precipitated the birth of our nation, as well as a symbol of the knowledge which flows from Thaliak's divine ewer.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: This is the reason you see an abundance of fountains throughout the city, and a propensity for utilizing water as a decorative feature in our architecture.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Yes, this is the place we wanted to be, but we're one short...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: This grand structure before you is the Rostra!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: The name refers to the original public platform erected here, upon which a “forum” of elected representatives would deliver orations and debate policy.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Although the stage has since evolved into council chambers, the nature of the Forum and the duties of its members remain largely unchanged.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: ...Am I boring you, Raha? You seem awfully distracted.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: My apologies. From here, one can see the entire city spread out below...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: The vista put me in mind of my arrival in the First. Those who had gathered at the Crystal Tower asked me how they might go about building a new home.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Naturally, my answers were all inspired by my knowledge of the finest settlement I could think of─the great city of Sharlayan.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: And bit by bit, those few buildings grew into a town. A community. The Crystarium... I can almost see its echo...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I see... Feel free to come up here whenever you wish─I don't think the councilors would object to you simply enjoying the view. Such memories should be treasured.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: For now, however, the tour must go on! Our spectacle of sightseeing concludes with the fittingly named Journey's End. Walk down the stairs to the east, and continue straight ahead!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Do you not feel the cold? Granted, it is not terribly chilly for these northern climes, but compared to the temperate weather of Limsa Lominsa...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: This neighborhood is home to the highest echelons of Sharlayan society. I never did feel comfortable enough to wander these streets on a whim.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: The district of Journey's End occupies the eastern block of the city, so all we need to do is take the stairs down from the Rostra...and keep heading east, of course!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: We've arrived at Journey's End, except I don't see Raha...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: We've arrived at Journey's End! History tells us that this was where those who put ashore with Archon Nyunkrepf built their first homes.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: In the present day, it serves as the residential district for the most important officials and the oldest Sharlayan families.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: You'll see that one mansion is clearly larger than its neighbors─that estate belongs to our friends from House Leveilleur. All things considered, we should probably keep our distance for the time being...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: And with that, we bring our little Sharlayan tour to a close. I hope it has proven to be an entertaining and enlightening experience!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Now, shall we head directly to the Baldesion Annex? You remember the way, don't you, Raha?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Let me think... We head down towards the harbor, cross the bridge to our right, then follow the path below the aetheryte plaza?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Correct! After you, Forename!

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: Discuss Journey's End.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Ah, the good old annex! I used to bunk there whenever I had business in the city proper.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Like the time I came to submit the thesis for my Archon qualification...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: This is it! The Baldesion Annex!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Have I tired you out with all this walking? Not to worry, I had rooms prepared for you at the annex.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Just follow the path to the west side of the aetheryte, and we'll be there in no time.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Right, we cross this bridge here, as I recall. Stick to the path, and be careful not to end up back in the aetheryte plaza!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Sharlayan is full of educational and research institutions, but there are still professors who prefer to establish their own private practices.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Not that I ever attended the exclusive schools they run in these residences... Perhaps the twins could tell you more about them.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: This building is the Baldesion Annex, but without Raha...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: As the joyous look on Raha's face has undoubtedly informed you, this is the Baldesion Annex.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: If you continue up the hill, you'll arrive on the doorstep of Phenomenon...but I think we've explored enough for one day. We can take you there another time.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Inside with you, then!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I'm back! And I've brought Forename and Raha with me.

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Ah, you were right about the ship, then. Hello, G'raha, it's nice to see you again!

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: (-???-)And it's a pleasure to finally meet you, Forename. I've heard many a tale of your exploits.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Ojika!? Ojika Tsunjika! It has been an age...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Allow me to introduce Ojika─cousin of Ejika Tsunjika and administration officer for the Students of Baldesion. He oversees the day-to-day business of the annex.

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: I read the reports on the Eureka expedition. I hope Ejika didn't cause you too much trouble. He's impatient and impetuous, but a good sort at heart.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Allow me to introduce Ojika─cousin of Ejika Tsunjika and administration officer for the Students of Baldesion. He oversees the day-to-day business of the annex.

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: I read the reports on the Eureka expedition... Ejika's passing grieved me beyond words. Thank you for standing by him until the end.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Allow me to introduce Ojika Tsunjika─administration officer for the Students of Baldesion. He oversees the day-to-day business of the annex. You may recall meeting his cousin, Ejika?

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: Oh yes, Eureka. I've read the initial reports─quite a shock to hear what's become of the isle. Do take care if you have the opportunity to rejoin the expedition.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Allow me to introduce Ojika Tsunjika─administration officer for the Students of Baldesion. He oversees the day-to-day business of the annex.

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: The “champion of Eorzea” has featured prominently in Krile and G'raha's reports, so for me, this is akin to seeing a fabled hero come to life! It is an honor to make your acquaintance.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: This place is like a second home for the Students... The Isle of Val served as our main headquarters, of course, but we often had occasion to visit Sharlayan.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Whether to make use of the city's research facilities, attend conferences, or procure supplies from distant shores...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: And the annex here was built to provide lodgings for our members while we engaged in such activities.

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: Now that our former headquarters is on the wrong side of the world─among other things─the annex has become our new base of operations, for all intents and purposes.

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: And yet it feels so empty. With so many lost to us, our organization is a shell of its former self.

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: Ever since our former headquarters─along with the isle itself─vanished, the annex has served as our base of operations.

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: And yet it feels so empty. With so many lost to us, our organization is a shell of its former self.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: The day will come when we will see the Students rise again...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: But first, we must ensure that the Telophoroi fall!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Through that door on the left there is the main hall, where we can discuss our options moving forward.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: ...Once everyone arrives, that is. You probably have time to rest before our discussions begin in earnest.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I've had private quarters prepared for you in the andron, so please, feel free to make yourself at home!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Ah, the nap rooms! Perfect for an afternoon doze...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Oh, I didn't mean to give you the wrong impression─the chambers are quite well appointed! Far more so than some cheap roadside inn, you may be assured.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: 'Twas simply that we were often so busy with research, or exhausted from journeys abroad, that we would slip into the andron just to steal a few winks.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: And thus they became known amongst the Students as “nap rooms”─even if many such “naps” might last well into the following morning!

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: Say the word, and I'll be happy to show you to your chamber.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Hopefully the others won't be too long in coming! I'll wait for you all in the main hall.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Do you have papers pasted on the walls of your room? 'Twas not unusual for occupants to pin up notes or documents and such, and then forget to take them when they went on their merry way.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Sometimes it was quite deliberate, though. You might see complaints addressed to other members, or a thank-you card for the engrossing literature someone left behind.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Beloved traditions...that I should know better than to dwell upon. If we are to create a future for the Students of Baldesion and so many others, we must look to the days ahead.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Feeling refreshed and alert? Our colleagues should be wandering in soon, so I suggest we stay here and wait for them to join us.
